conclusion: The problem involves determining which blocks car A will collide with and where it will eventually stop based on power, collision, and deflection effects.
The image shows car A approaching a group of blocks arranged in clusters of different colors: yellow, green, red, blue, and orange.
The yellow block is isolated and positioned at the front edge of the cluster.
Car A will first strike the single yellow block at the front edge of the cluster.
Because the yellow block is light and isolated, car A will plow through it almost without slowing.
With only a slight deflection, car A continues and next collides with the two-block green stack.
The green stack consists of two blocks stacked vertically.
The green stack topples upon collision, and the impact robs car A of most of its remaining speed.
Car A then drifts a short distance and finally stops in the gap between the fallen green blocks and the taller red stack.
The red stack is taller and positioned further away from the green stack.
Car A does not reach the red stack or the blue/orange stacks.
